body:
[![Kemal](https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/u/15321198?v=3&s=200)](http://kemalcr.com)

# Kemal

Lightning Fast, Super Simple web framework.

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/kemalcr/kemal.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/kemalcr/kemal)
[![Join the chat at https://gitter.im/sdogruyol/kemal](https://badges.gitter.im/Join%20Chat.svg)](https://gitter.im/sdogruyol/kemal?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=badge)

# Super Simple ⚡️

```ruby
require "kemal"

# Matches GET "http://host:port/"
get "/" do
  "Hello World!"
end

# Creates a WebSocket handler.
# Matches "ws://host:port/socket"
ws "/socket" do |socket|
  socket.send "Hello from Kemal!"
end

Kemal.run
```

Start your application!

```
crystal src/kemal_sample.cr
```
Go to *http://localhost:3000*

Check [documentation](http://kemalcr.com) or [samples](https://github.com/kemalcr/kemal/tree/master/samples) for more.

# Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  kemal:
    github: kemalcr/kemal
```

See also [Getting Started](http://kemalcr.com/guide/).

# Features

- Support all REST verbs
- Websocket support
- Request/Response context, easy parameter handling
- Middleware support
- Built-in JSON support
- Built-in static file serving
- Built-in view templating via [Kilt](https://github.com/jeromegn/kilt)

# Documentation

You can read the documentation at the official site [kemalcr.com](http://kemalcr.com)

## Thanks

Thanks to Manas for their awesome work on [Frank](https://github.com/manastech/frank).

constants.name: HTTP_METHODS
constants.doc:
Kemal DSL is defined here and it's baked into global scope.

The DSL currently consists of:

- get post put patch delete options
- WebSocket(ws)
- before_*
- error
constants.summary: Kemal DSL is defined here and it's baked into global scope.

class_methods.name: add_handler
class_methods.doc:
Adds given `Kemal::Handler` to handlers chain.
There are 5 handlers by default and all the custom handlers
goes between the first 4 and the last `Kemal::RouteHandler`.

- `Kemal::InitHandler`
- `Kemal::LogHandler`
- `Kemal::ExceptionHandler`
- `Kemal::StaticFileHandler`
- Here goes custom handlers
- `Kemal::RouteHandler`

class_methods.name: gzip
class_methods.doc:
Configures an `HTTP::Server::Response` to compress the response
output, either using gzip or deflate, depending on the `Accept-Encoding` request header.

Disabled by default.
class_methods.summary: Configures an HTTP::Server::Response to compress the response output, either using gzip or deflate, depending on the Accept-Encoding request header.

class_methods.name: headers
class_methods.doc:
Helper for easily modifying response headers.
This can be used to modify a response header with the given hash.

```
def call(env)
  headers(env, {"X-Custom-Header" => "This is a custom value"})
end
```

class_methods.name: log
class_methods.doc:
Logs the output via `logger`.
This is the built-in `Kemal::LogHandler` by default which uses STDOUT.

class_methods.name: logger
class_methods.doc:
This is used to replace the built-in `Kemal::LogHandler` with a custom logger.

A custom logger must inherit from `Kemal::BaseLogHandler` and must implement
`call(env)`, `write(message)` methods.

```
class MyCustomLogger < Kemal::BaseLogHandler
  def call(env)
    puts "I'm logging some custom stuff here."
    call_next(env) # => This calls the next handler
  end

  # This is used from `log` method.
  def write(message)
    STDERR.puts message # => Logs the output to STDERR
  end
end
```

Now that we have a custom logger here's how we use it

```
logger MyCustomLogger.new
```
class_methods.summary: This is used to replace the built-in Kemal::LogHandler with a custom logger.

class_methods.name: logging
class_methods.doc:
Enables / Disables logging.
This is enabled by default.

```
logging false
```

class_methods.name: public_folder
class_methods.doc:
Sets public folder from which the static assets will be served.

By default this is `/public` not `src/public`.
class_methods.summary: Sets public folder from which the static assets will be served.

def.name: render_500
def.body:
context.response.status_code = 500
template = if verbosity
  (Kemal::ExceptionPage.for_runtime_exception(context, exception)).to_s
else
  Kemal::ExceptionPage.for_production_exception
end
context.response.print(template)
context

class_methods.name: send_file
class_methods.doc:
Send a file with given path and base the mime-type on the file extension
or default `application/octet-stream` mime_type.

```
send_file env, "./path/to/file"
```

Optionally you can override the mime_type

```
send_file env, "./path/to/file", "image/jpeg"
```
class_methods.summary: Send a file with given path and base the mime-type on the file extension or default application/octet-stream mime_type.
class_methods.args_string: (env : HTTP::Server::Context, path : String, mime_type : String? = nil)

def.name: send_file
def.body:
config = Kemal.config.serve_static
file_path = File.expand_path(path, Dir.current)
mime_type || (mime_type = Kemal::Utils.mime_type(file_path))
env.response.content_type = mime_type
env.response.headers["Accept-Ranges"] = "bytes"
env.response.headers["X-Content-Type-Options"] = "nosniff"
minsize = 860
request_headers = env.request.headers
filesize = File.size(file_path)
filestat = File.info(file_path)
Kemal.config.static_headers.try(&.call(env.response, file_path, filestat))
File.open(file_path) do |file|
  if (env.request.method == "GET") && (env.request.headers.has_key?("Range"))
    next multipart(file, env)
  end
  condition = ((config.is_a?(Hash) && (config["gzip"]? == true)) && filesize > minsize) && (Kemal::Utils.zip_types(file_path))
  if condition && (request_headers.includes_word?("Accept-Encoding", "gzip"))
    env.response.headers["Content-Encoding"] = "gzip"
    Gzip::Writer.open(env.response) do |deflate|
      IO.copy(file, deflate)
    end
  else
    if condition && (request_headers.includes_word?("Accept-Encoding", "deflate"))
      env.response.headers["Content-Encoding"] = "deflate"
      Flate::Writer.open(env.response) do |deflate|
        IO.copy(file, deflate)
      end
    else
      env.response.content_length = filesize
      IO.copy(file, env.response)
    end
  end
end
return

class_methods.name: send_file
class_methods.doc:
Send a file with given data and default `application/octet-stream` mime_type.

```
send_file env, data_slice
```

Optionally you can override the mime_type

```
send_file env, data_slice, "image/jpeg"
```
class_methods.summary: Send a file with given data and default application/octet-stream mime_type.
class_methods.args_string: (env : HTTP::Server::Context, data : Slice(UInt8), mime_type : String? = nil)

def.name: send_file
def.body:
mime_type || (mime_type = "application/octet-stream")
env.response.content_type = mime_type
env.response.content_length = data.bytesize
env.response.write(data)

class_methods.name: serve_static
class_methods.doc:
Enables / Disables static file serving.
This is enabled by default.

```
serve_static false
```

Static server also have some advanced customization options like `dir_listing` and
`gzip`.

```
serve_static {"gzip" => true, "dir_listing" => false}
```

class_methods.name: static_headers
class_methods.doc:
Adds headers to `Kemal::StaticFileHandler`. This is especially useful for `CORS`.

```
static_headers do |response, filepath, filestat|
  if filepath =~ /\.html$/
    response.headers.add("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", "*")
  end
  response.headers.add("Content-Size", filestat.size.to_s)
end
```

macros.name: add_context_storage_type
macros.doc:
Extends context storage with user defined types.

```
class User
  property name
end

add_context_storage_type(User)
```
macros.summary: Extends context storage with user defined types.

macros.name: content_for
macros.doc:
`content_for` is a set of helpers that allows you to capture
blocks inside views to be rendered later during the request. The most
common use is to populate different parts of your layout from your view.

The currently supported engines are: ecr and slang.

## Usage

You call `content_for`, generally from a view, to capture a block of markup
giving it an identifier:

```
# index.ecr
<% content_for "some_key" do %>
  <chunk of="html">...</chunk>
<% end %>
```

Then, you call `yield_content` with that identifier, generally from a
layout, to render the captured block:

```
# layout.ecr
<%= yield_content "some_key" %>
```

## And How Is This Useful?

For example, some of your views might need a few javascript tags and
stylesheets, but you don't want to force this files in all your pages.
Then you can put `<%= yield_content :scripts_and_styles %>` on your
layout, inside the <head> tag, and each view can call `content_for`
setting the appropriate set of tags that should be added to the layout.
macros.summary: content_for is a set of helpers that allows you to capture blocks inside views to be rendered later during the request.

def.name: content_for

macros.name: halt
macros.doc:
Halt execution with the current context.
Returns 200 and an empty response by default.

```
halt env, status_code: 403, response: "Forbidden"
```

macros.name: render
macros.doc:
Render view with a layout as the superview.

```
render "src/views/index.ecr", "src/views/layout.ecr"
```
macros.summary: Render view with a layout as the superview.

macros.name: render

macros.name: yield_content
macros.doc: Yields content for the given key if a `content_for` block exists for that key.
macros.summary: Yields content for the given key if a content_for block exists for that key.

def.name: yield_content
display_startup_message
def.body:
addresses = server.addresses.map do |address|
  "#{config.scheme}://#{address}"
end.join(", ")
log("[#{config.env}] Kemal is ready to lead at #{addresses}")

class_methods.name: run
class_methods.doc: Overload of `self.run` with the default startup logging.
class_methods.summary: Overload of self.run with the default startup logging.

class_methods.name: run
class_methods.doc:
The command to run a `Kemal` application.

If *port* is not given Kemal will use `Kemal::Config#port`

To use custom command line arguments, set args to nil
class_methods.summary: The command to run a Kemal application.

def.name: run
def.body:
Kemal::CLI.new(args)
config = Kemal.config
config.setup
if port
  config.port = port
end
if config.env != "test"
  setup_404
  setup_trap_signal
end
server = config.server || (config.server = HTTP::Server.new(config.handlers))
config.running = true
yield config
if config.running
else
  return
end
if server.each_address do |_|
  break true
end
else
  {% if flag?(:without_openssl) %}
        server.bind_tcp(config.host_binding, config.port)
      {% else %}
        if ssl = config.ssl
          server.bind_tls(config.host_binding, config.port, ssl)
        else
          server.bind_tcp(config.host_binding, config.port)
        end
      {% end %}
end
display_startup_message(config, server)
if config.env == "test"
else
  server.listen
end

class_methods.name: run
class_methods.doc: Overload of `self.run` to allow just a block.
class_methods.summary: Overload of self.run to allow just a block.

def.name: stop
def.body:
if !config.running
  raise("Kemal is already stopped.")
end
if server = config.server
  if server.closed?
  else
    server.close
  end
  config.running = false
else
  raise("Kemal.config.server is not set. Please use Kemal.run to set the server.")
end

types.name: CLI
types.doc: Handles all the initialization from the command line.
types.summary: Handles all the initialization from the command line.

types.name: Config
types.doc:
Stores all the configuration options for a Kemal application.
It's a singleton and you can access it like.

```
Kemal.config
```
types.summary: Stores all the configuration options for a Kemal application.

def.name: add_error_handler
def.body:
ERROR_HANDLERS[status_code] = ->(context : HTTP::Server::Context, error : Exception) do
  (handler.call(context, error)).to_s
end

def.name: clear
setup
def.body:
if @default_handlers_setup && @router_included
else
  setup_init_handler
  setup_log_handler
  setup_error_handler
  setup_static_file_handler
  setup_custom_handlers
  setup_filter_handlers
  @default_handlers_setup = true
  @router_included = true
  HANDLERS.insert(HANDLERS.size, Kemal::WebSocketHandler::INSTANCE)
  HANDLERS.insert(HANDLERS.size, Kemal::RouteHandler::INSTANCE)
end

types.name: ExceptionHandler
types.doc: Handles all the exceptions, including 404, custom errors and 500.
types.summary: Handles all the exceptions, including 404, custom errors and 500.

def.name: call
def.body:
begin
  call_next(context)
rescue ex : Kemal::Exceptions::RouteNotFound
  call_exception_with_status_code(context, ex, 404)
rescue ex : Kemal::Exceptions::CustomException
  call_exception_with_status_code(context, ex, context.response.status_code)
rescue ex : Exception
  log("Exception: #{ex.inspect_with_backtrace}")
  if Kemal.config.error_handlers.has_key?(500)
    return call_exception_with_status_code(context, ex, 500)
  end
  verbosity = Kemal.config.env == "production" ? false : true
  return render_500(context, ex, verbosity)
end

def.name: for_production_exception

types.name: Exceptions
types.doc: Exceptions for 404 and custom errors are defined here.
types.summary: Exceptions for 404 and custom errors are defined here.

types.name: Handler
types.doc:
`Kemal::Handler` is a subclass of `HTTP::Handler`.

It adds `only`, `only_match?`, `exclude`, `exclude_match?`.
These methods are useful for the conditional execution of custom handlers .

instance_methods.name: exclude_match?
instance_methods.doc:
Processes the path based on `exclude` paths which is a `Array(String)`.
If the path is not found on `exclude` conditions the handler will continue processing.
If the path is found in `exclude` conditions it'll stop processing and will pass the request
to next handler.

However this is not done automatically. All handlers must inherit from `Kemal::Handler`.

```
class ExcludeHandler < Kemal::Handler
  exclude ["/"]

  def call(env)
    return call_next(env) if exclude_match?(env)
    puts "If the path is not / i will be doing some processing here."
  end
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Processes the path based on exclude paths which is a Array(String).

instance_methods.name: only_match?
instance_methods.doc:
Processes the path based on `only` paths which is a `Array(String)`.
If the path is not found on `only` conditions the handler will continue processing.
If the path is found in `only` conditions it'll stop processing and will pass the request
to next handler.

However this is not done automatically. All handlers must inherit from `Kemal::Handler`.

```
class OnlyHandler < Kemal::Handler
  only ["/"]

  def call(env)
    return call_next(env) unless only_match?(env)
    puts "If the path is / i will be doing some processing here."
  end
end
```
instance_methods.summary: Processes the path based on only paths which is a Array(String).

def.name: exclude
only

types.name: InitHandler
types.doc:
Initializes the context with default values, such as
*Content-Type* or *X-Powered-By* headers.
types.summary: Initializes the context with default values, such as Content-Type or X-Powered-By headers.

def.name: call
def.body:
if Kemal.config.powered_by_header
  context.response.headers.add("X-Powered-By", "Kemal")
end
if context.response.headers.has_key?("Content-Type")
else
  context.response.content_type = "text/html"
end
call_next(context)

types.name: LogHandler
types.doc: Uses `STDOUT` by default and handles the logging of request/response process time.
types.summary: Uses STDOUT by default and handles the logging of request/response process time.

def.name: call
def.body:
time = Time.now
call_next(context)
elapsed_text = elapsed_text(Time.now - time)
(((((((((@io << time) << ' ') << context.response.status_code) << ' ') << context.request.method) << ' ') << context.request.resource) << ' ') << elapsed_text) << '\n'
context

types.name: NullLogHandler
types.doc: This is here to represent the logger corresponding to Null Object Pattern.
types.summary: This is here to represent the logger corresponding to Null Object Pattern.

types.name: ParamParser
types.doc:
Parses the request contents including query_params and body
and converts them into a params hash which you can use within
the environment context.
types.summary: Parses the request contents including query_params and body and converts them into a params hash which you can use within the environment context.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (request : HTTP::Request, url : Hash(String, String) = {} of String => String)

types.name: Route
types.doc:
Route is the main building block of Kemal.

It takes 3 parameters: http *method*, *path* and a *handler* to specify
what action to be done if the route is matched.
types.summary: Route is the main building block of Kemal.

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(method, path, &handler) do |_arg0|
  yield _arg0
end
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: add_route
instance_methods.doc:
Adds a given route to routing tree. As an exception each `GET` route additionaly defines
a corresponding `HEAD` route.
instance_methods.summary: Adds a given route to routing tree.

def.name: add_route
def.body:
add_to_radix_tree(method, path, Route.new(method, path, &handler))
if method == "GET"
  add_to_radix_tree("HEAD", path, Route.new("HEAD", path) do
  end)
end

instance_methods.name: lookup_route
instance_methods.doc: Looks up the route from the Radix::Tree for the first time and caches to improve performance.
instance_methods.summary: Looks up the route from the Radix::Tree for the first time and caches to improve performance.

def.name: lookup_route
def.body:
lookup_path = radix_path(verb, path)
if cached_route = @cached_routes[lookup_path]?
  return cached_route
end
route = @routes.find(lookup_path)
if route.found?
  if @cached_routes.size == CACHED_ROUTES_LIMIT
    @cached_routes.clear
  end
  @cached_routes[lookup_path] = route
end
route

def.name: call
def.body:
if context.request.path.not_nil! == "/"
  return call_next(context)
end
case context.request.method
when "GET", "HEAD"
else
  if @fallthrough
    call_next(context)
  else
    context.response.status_code = 405
    context.response.headers.add("Allow", "GET, HEAD")
  end
  return
end
config = Kemal.config.serve_static
original_path = context.request.path.not_nil!
request_path = URI.unescape(original_path)
if request_path.includes?('\u{0}')
  context.response.status_code = 400
  return
end
expanded_path = File.expand_path(request_path, "/")
is_dir_path = if (original_path.ends_with?('/')) && (!(expanded_path.ends_with?('/')))
  expanded_path = expanded_path + '/'
  true
else
  expanded_path.ends_with?('/')
end
file_path = File.join(@public_dir, expanded_path)
is_dir = Dir.exists?(file_path)
if request_path != expanded_path
  redirect_to(context, expanded_path)
else
  if is_dir && (!is_dir_path)
    redirect_to(context, expanded_path + '/')
  end
end
if Dir.exists?(file_path)
  if config.is_a?(Hash) && (config["dir_listing"] == true)
    context.response.content_type = "text/html"
    directory_listing(context.response, request_path, file_path)
  else
    return call_next(context)
  end
else
  if File.exists?(file_path)
    last_modified = modification_time(file_path)
    add_cache_headers(context.response.headers, last_modified)
    if cache_request?(context, last_modified)
      context.response.status_code = 304
      return
    end
    send_file(context, file_path)
  else
    call_next(context)
  end
end

def.name: mime_type
def.body:
case File.extname(path)
when ".txt"
  "text/plain"
when ".htm", ".html"
  "text/html"
when ".css"
  "text/css"
when ".js"
  "application/javascript"
when ".png"
  "image/png"
when ".jpg", ".jpeg"
  "image/jpeg"
when ".gif"
  "image/gif"
when ".svg"
  "image/svg+xml"
when ".ico"
  "image/x-icon"
when ".xml"
  "application/xml"
when ".json"
  "application/json"
when ".otf", ".ttf"
  "application/font-sfnt"
when ".woff"
  "application/font-woff"
when ".woff2"
  "font/woff2"
when ".mp4"
  "video/mp4"
when ".webm"
  "video/webm"
else
  "application/octet-stream"
end

types.name: WebSocket
types.doc:
Takes 2 parameters: *path* and a *handler* to specify
what action to be done if the route is matched.
types.summary: Takes 2 parameters: path and a handler to specify what action to be done if the route is matched.

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(path, &proc) do |_arg0, _arg1|
  yield _arg0, _arg1
end
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: call
def.body:
if context.ws_route_found? && (websocket_upgrade_request?(context))
else
  return call_next(context)
end
content = context.websocket.call(context)
context.response.print(content)
context
